author: Kenton Chun
content:
Going into camp was a new experience for me; we get to live a studio for two weeks and do nothing but dedicate ourselves to football. It's exciting, but tiring. Here is my playbook (with no plays) and where I'll be sleeping for two weeks.

Now it's time to compete. It's going to be an uphill battle, but so was everything before this. "If your chances are one in a million, why can't 'you' be that one"

I'm really glad that Coach Tomy had us doing tackling drills. Though I'm not good, as you will see (in the video), any little bit of practice will be useful because you never know what may happen in a game.


http://www.staradvertiser.com/sports/sportsnews/20110417_defense_should_lead_the_way.html
title: Summer Camp

author: Kenton Chun
content: I was very happy to go to the Big Island with the team and now I get to play in the Warrior Bowl. I was able to convert two field goals. They weren't perfect kicks, but they went through.
title: Warrior Bowl 4/15/2011

author: Kenton Chun
content:
I was able to play as a back up in the UC Davis game. I was 3/3 on extra points and they were great kicks (good hight, time, and accuracy). This was a good way to earn back my spot. I won't be going to La Tech, for I'm no longer starting and there's no sense to waste a spot to a non starter.

I'll be at home cheering on the Warriors. Then it's time to work, because it's a bye week.

VS UC Davis - W 56-14
VS La Tech - W 44-26
title: VS UC Davis (9/25/11) and VS La Tech (10/1/11)

author: Kenton Chun
content: Just when I thought football was completely behind me.
title: All-Academic Honors for 2011 Fall Sports

author: Kenton Chun
content:
We needed this win to have hopes of going to a bowl game. What a great feeling it is to win again. My knee was still not letting me kick to potential, but I made them all this game.

(Sorry no pictures from this game)
title: VS Tulane (11/26/11)

author: Kenton Chun
content: The pressure was on this game, so we could get into a bowl game. It almost came down to a field goal again. My knee was still giving me problems, but it was good enough to play.
title: VS Fresno State (11/19/11)

author: Kenton Chun
content:
I don't have much to say, but very I'm very blessed an fortunate to get this recognition

The media was buzzing around after the Idaho game so here are some pictures from the week following. Nothing like being a kicker again.

http://warriorbeat.staradvertiserblogs.com/2011/11/03/thursday-2/http://www.staradvertiser.com/sportspremium/20111106_warriors_must_to_meet_force_with_force.html
title: The Next Practice

author: Kenton Chun
content: Thanks Coach Mac and Coach Mouse for the nice words.
title: VS Utah State Pregame Interview

author: Kenton Chun
content: I was very fortunate to be an extra on Hawaii 5-0. Not very long, but still got experience something new through the sport I love.
title: Hawaii 5-0

author: Kenton Chun
content:
Coach Peter Kim has been helping me since high school at Saint Louis. He's never given up on me regardless of my (lack of) potential. He knew I loved football and would never give up on me. With his help I was able to live out my dream of playing D1 football for the Warriors. I can never thank him enough for everything he did and hopefully I can pass on his generosity to help another young athlete that deserves an opportunity.

The StarAdvertiser did a nice write-up you can find below.

http://www.staradvertiser.com/sportspremium/20111101__Mentors_persistence_keeps_Chun_in_the_game.html
title: My Mentor

author: Kenton Chun
content: This was a nice banquet at the Sheraton. It was nice to see all the players can coaches one last time all together.
title: Na Koa Annual Awards Banquet (12/4/11)

author: Kenton Chun
content:
This is important for me to use the two weeks to show the coaches I can get the job done. We've had some kicks blocked against us, but I do not think it is the kickers. However, the better I perform the better my chances of playing are.

Also Mike Cherry asked me to be on the Coach Mac show, to perform some magic. You can find it here:
title: Bye Week

author: Kenton Chun
content: I've been officially added to the Spring 2011 football roster. It's now time to make the most out of this opportunity. The goal is to make it to camp and with only 104 spots. There are about two dozen new recruits (not here now), and currently 120 players; it's going to be tough.
title: Spring Ball 2011 (Added to the Roster)

author: Kenton Chun
content:
I'd like to take the time and say thank you to Coach Greg McMackin, Coach Dick Tomy, and Coach Peter Kim for everything they did for me. They are the ones that gave me the opportunities for my success. It was sad to see Coach Mack, Coach Tomy, and the rest of the football staff not return for another season. I wish them all the best for they are great coaches and great people.

Good luck to Coach Chow and the 2012 Warriors.

http://hawaiiathletics.com/news/2011/12/5/FB_1205110255.aspx?path=football
title: Mahalo

author: Kenton Chun
content: This song gave me chills when I first heard it. It brought back memories of what was and what could've been; what was great and what wasn't; and how close we were, yet so far. It reall makes me want to play again.
title: Bowl Week

author: Kenton Chun
content: Right in the middle of spring ball and happy to be in the mix. Check out this clipping from the StarAdvertiser.
title: Spring Ball 2011

author: Kenton Chun
content:
They tested all the seniors for the NFL.

  • Kenton Chun: 5-5 1/2 (height), 153 (weight), 8 1/2 (hand), 28 (reach), 66 3/8 (wing span)

It's wishful thinking to make it to the NFL, but I need to focus on my first and last season as a Warrior.

http://warriorbeat.staradvertiserblogs.com/2011/05/06/class-act/
title: Pro-football Evaluation

author: Kenton Chun
content:
This was my first away game. The Husky Stadium is really tall and each sideline, which makes it really loud. I had one blocked, and it looks like I'll be on the sideline for a while. But, don't worry I'll still be working.


VS. Washington - L 40-32
VS. UNLV - L 40-20
title: VS Washington (9/10/11) and VS UNLV (9/17/11)

author: Kenton Chun
content: Trying to keep in shape, I played in the Hawaii Gridiron League (HGL).   Love the idea behind it, but not the same level as Division 1 football.
title: Hawaii Gridiron League

author: Kenton Chun
content:
I'm back! I'll be starting the San Jose game.

After having several blocked kicks (not only with me) and a game where it made the difference, I'm glad to see that we're changing the protection. This new protection is what the NFL uses and what feels most comfortable. Sadly, I can't help be fell like I could have done more

VS San Jose - L 27-28See how the media reacted to this see game below


http://warriorbeat.staradvertiserblogs.com/2011/10/10/monday-musings/
title: VS San Jose (10/14/11)

author: Kenton Chun
content:
This is my first college game and I get to play! Coach Tomy wanted the games to decide who plays. So he allowed me to kick all extra points and close field goals. I can't say I wasn't nervous and I don't know how many kickers made a field goal like this on their first kick, nevertheless it went in and we won 34-7.

It was quite an experience. I got to stay at the hotel with the team the night before, get a police escort to the stadium and have my equipment ready from me.

Coming out of the tunnel and seeing this crowd with the band and cheerleaders, was a dream come true.


http://www.staradvertiser.com/news/breaking/129202878.html
title: VS Colorado (9/3/11)

author: Kenton Chun
content:
Coach Tomy and Coach Mac agreed to let my knee rest in hopes to get it better for the remainder of the season; therefore I did not play this game.

L 35- 31

http://www.staradvertiser.com/sportspremium/20111106_Moniz_joins_elite_club.html
http://www.staradvertiser.com/sports/20111112_itll_be_aults_offense_vs_arandas_defense.html
title: VS Utah State (11/5/11)

author: Kenton Chun
content:
I've been officially added to the roster. We have a tough schedule as road games are never easy, but we are very talented this year. Competitions is tough and it's getting tougher; the pressure is building, but I need to remained focus.


http://hawaiiathletics.com/roster.aspx?rp_id=8986&path=football
http://www.staradvertiser.com/columnistspremium/20110818_Warriors_kicking_job_will_be_won_the_old-fashioned_way.html
http://warriorbeat.staradvertiserblogs.com/2011/08/25/depth-chart/
title: Regular Season, It Begins

author: Kenton Chun
content:
I represented the specialist in the "Hawaii's Got Talent" talent show before camp ended. I've never had the best of luck with talent shows nor do I have a lot of stage effects, but it was still fun. We came in third, because I'm terrible at jan ken po (rock, paper, scissor). However, from what I've heard, it was a lot better than the previous years for the specialist.


http://warriorbeat.staradvertiserblogs.com/2011/08/19/d-line-was-a-delight/
title: Talent Show

author: Kenton Chun
content:
My percentages are a little flip-flopped for extra points and field goals compared to most kickers, but at least I can say I played D1 football and was perfect on field goals.

http://hawaiiathletics.com/custompages/Stats/Fball/2011/PLYR_4G.HTM
title: Season Stats

author: Kenton Chun
content:
It was great to make the roster for spring-ball.  I got to make an impact on my first day; what luck.  "Kick till you miss" was Coach Tomy's instruction.  I'm glad everything came together.  And I didn't know it then, but this was the most important day to set up my season.

And just for clarification, I was at SOU (Southern Oregon University) not Southern Utah.  

http://warriorbeat.staradvertiserblogs.com/2011/03/10/thursday-ramblings-4/
http://warriorbeat.staradvertiserblogs.com/2011/03/16/proving-ground/
title: Spring Ball 2011- Tryout

author: Kenton Chun
content:
It's Homecoming!

With the new protection for our field goal/PAT team, I ended up over kicking an injuring my knee.

I was able to make the first 3, but the 3rd kick didn't look great, because my knee gave out (see my form). Unfortunately, Tyler didn't have a great day filling in for me, and the media continued to criticize the field goal unit. I took that personally, and will work harder to get healthy again.

I also got to be called "the little guy."

VS San Jose - W 45-34


http://www.staradvertiser.com/sportspremium/20111023_warriors_notebook.html?c=n
http://www.staradvertiser.com/sportspremium/20111024_Youd_think_Warriors_would_have_extra_points_down_PAT.html
title: VS New Mexico State (10/22/11)

author: Kenton Chun
content:
Who knew making the traveling squad this week would turn into this?!

After hurting my knee, I would only travel if I could kick. So on the day we were scheduled to leave, I was able to put the ball through the uprights and coach game me ok to travel.

And what luck! I ended up traveling and got put into a kickers dream. Down by one, in the forth quarter, I was called on to put us in the lead, and was able to execute. Big thanks to the Luke (snapper), Shane (holder), and the line for allowing me the opportunity to make the kick. A great team win; the defense for getting the turnover, offense for driving the ball, and special teams for doing everything right to allow me to put my foot on that ball.


VS Idaho - W 16-14

author: Kenton Chun
content:
It's nice to know that I'm missed and I made a difference, even if it's just a little bit.

http://www.staradvertiser.com/sportspremium/sportsnewspremium/20120314_Paradise_lost_on_Demarest.html?id=142593466
title: Not Forgotten Yet

author: Kenton Chun
content:
It's so cold in Reno! I still don't know why we played at night.

I was able to hit a field goal and all my extra points in the cold weather (even if it wasn't my best). What a new experience. Unfortunately, we didn't get the W.

L 42-28

http://www.staradvertiser.com/sports/20111113__Hawaii_special_teams_burned_at_end_.html
title: VS Nevada (UNR) (11/12/11)

author: Kenton Chun
content:
My first, actual missed extra point. It's a sad thing to say, but it happened. My knee completely gave out and there was not much I could do.

I had a great season and a great time with the 2011 Warriors. I wish I could've ended with a better game, on the kicks and the result of the game, but I wouldn't trade this experience for anything.

L 41-20

Enjoy the senior walk video.
title: VS BYU (12/3/11) and Senior Walk

title: WAC Player of the Week

author: Kenton Chun
content:
I'm Back!

Thanks to the HGL and AFL Global I got to play in a real game where I get paid; and it's arena ball. This game was on a new synthetic surface that was a little slippery and narrow goal posts. As much as I strive to be perfect, I did like this challenge.

I'm very grateful to get to play in front of my friends and family again. I also got a travel to China and experience the diverse culture there and do what I love.
title: AFL China
